rifsPrinciples.title: Sense of Place and Purpose
rifsPrinciples.description: Grounding innovations in local contexts, cultures, and community aspirations while maintaining alignment with broader regenerative goals.

rifsPrinciples.title: Ecological Design for Innovation
rifsPrinciples.description: Creating solutions that work with natural systems, enhance biodiversity, and regenerate ecosystem services rather than depleting them.

rifsPrinciples.title: Connectedness
rifsPrinciples.description: Fostering strong relationships and collaboration among all stakeholders—thinkers, enablers, and doers—across the food system.

rifsPrinciples.title: Fair, Just, and Inclusive Transition
rifsPrinciples.description: Ensuring that the benefits of food system transformation are shared equitably, with particular attention to disadvantaged groups.

rifsPrinciples.title: Living Process
rifsPrinciples.description: Embracing adaptation, learning, and continuous improvement through real-world experimentation and community feedback.

coreValues.description: Going beyond sustainability to actively restore and enhance ecological and social systems.
Ensuring all voices are heard, particularly those of disadvantaged and marginalized communities.
Breaking down silos and working across disciplines, sectors, and institutions.
Grounding decisions in rigorous research, local knowledge, and continuous learning.
